intro: Veronica amoena subsp. amoena, commonly known as the common speedwell, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring upright stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, blue to violet flowers with five petals, blooming from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodlands, and along stream banks. Veronica amoena subsp. amoena is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in herbal medicine.
